name: vaingloriously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows someone is too proud of their own abilities or achievements: He vaingloriously predicted that his death would spark a revolution. The book describes itself, a bit vaingloriously, as an essential reference guide.
More examplesFewer examplesHe vaingloriously likened their professional relationship to Michelangelo's with his patron Lorenzo il Magnifico.The story was vaingloriously proclaimed as a scoop in Sunday's news bulletins.She insists vaingloriously that she has now moved on spiritually in her life.
